item.title: Linear Regression
item.description: A1. Simple Linear Regression 1. Estimated Simple Regression Equation (link) If we choose the parameters \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\) in the simple linear regression model so as to minimize the sum of squares of the error term \(\epsilon\), we will have the so-called estimated simple regression equation. It allows us to compute fitted values of y based on values of x. \[\hat{y} = ax + b\] Problem Apply the simple linear regression model for the data set faithful, and estimate the next eruption duration if the waiting time since the last eruption has been 80 minutes.
